If it has a tendency to deceive, the SEC can restrict it, the Texas statute restricts it and we accept that and do not challenge it.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: But you said the state cannot legislate a prophylactic rule that it is got to deal with a case by case basis.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Well, not necessarily on a case by case basis.
The state can deal with the subject of deception without prophylactically abolishing all speech.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: What about the subject of trade names?
Can it prohibit a particular optometrist whom it is found to have used deceptive practices by the trade names from using a trade name?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, only the state could prevent him from using any type of deceptive name.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Including a trade name?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: If they were deceptive and in this instance, the trail court found as a matter of fact that this is not a misleading or a deceptive name.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: And you feel that three judge district court has right to substitute its judgment for the legislature on that?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, but it is required to make a finding of fact just to whether or not this question, this use is or is not misleading.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: The three judge district court in dealing with a constitutional challenge to a statute is required to make a finding of fact as to whether a trade name is misleading?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir because if it were misleading, then there would be no impermissible infringement on speech because the court has held that the state can suppress misleading speech.
So the district court must determine, is this truthful or is it misleading.
If it is misleading, then you do not have the same free speech right that you have if it is truthful and that's the reason to finding a fact is required to be made by the court yesterday.
The state speaks and I would like to speak briefly to the purported justifications for this absolute suppression and weigh them respectfully against the consequences or the harm that falls --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Could Texas require that if you want to do business under a trade name, you must go up to the state house or down to the county clerk's office and file a statement of the names of the people who are behind the trade name.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: And keep it constantly current?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir and prohibit as you suggest respectively sir, and prohibit the transfer of that name in the practice of a profession.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: But you don't think they can make them put the names on the door.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, I think they can make them put the name on the door as well.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Can they make them put the names of everybody in the group on their stationary and in their advertisements?
Apparently not, that is what you say.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, if that becomes necessary, they can, but that is not what they have done Mr. Justice White.
What they have done, they said you cannot rather than you must and there is a substantial difference in the area of speech.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Is it doing a business under a trade name, if you use a trade name and then give all the names.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, it would be.
For example, my client could not with his brother and three others, list their names and say associated in the --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: If you really would not care very much, if you had to put down all the names, would you really want to use the trade names?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes indeed because the trade name is valuable, it has a substantial communicative value and thus is of substantial value to my client.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: You want to value that past activity as given to it even though the people are different.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir.

If the people are different and if the stock operator as you described, this optometrist has come in, the state could require that before he adopt that name, he must meet certain standards or tests or not even at all purchase the name, but that is not what the state has done here, they just made an absolute suppression.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: I did not get a direct answer.
You say they can be required to list all of the names?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, they are not presently required to do so.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Alright, if they could be, you say it would be alright?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That is my belief, yes sir.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, does that mean all other names of all of the offices on all of the office doors?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: If there were some interest of the state to be served by such and this did not become an oppressive burden to speech, I would think so, yes sir.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: But is it oppressive burden of speech?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: If I am required to list 200 names on a letterhead, that would become oppressive because it could not write anything else on the paper and thus it would constitute I think an impingement of speech, but the state has not done that.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: So, what is your answer to my question.
Could the state require it or not?
You just slip right over, this wouldn't be alright.
I did not think you meant it then, and I know you do not mean it now.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, I believe the state can require until it becomes an oppressive burden and effectively deny a speech, and that is my intellectually honest belief that it is not unreasonable until it constitutes a denial of speech.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Do you see any analogy between the situation you are discussing and the rule of this court that required you to sign your own name to this brief, not your firm's name?
Your firm name is on and you are guessing what your relationship is but you personally had signed this brief, didn't you?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir and I made the identical disclosure to this court that Dr. Rogers makes to his patient.
I have my firm name on the brief.
Dr. Rogers has his firm name Texas State Optical on his door or on his stationary.
Likewise, I have personally signed the brief, the optometrist personally signs the prescription.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: So, not the advertising to extent there is any advertising material.
Is that in the name of that -- in what name would that be done?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That would be done in the name of Texas State Optical, yes sir and in his trade name.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Which he can put on the prescription?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, he can put that on the prescription and it is --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: I thought he had to put his own name on.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: He can put his own name on there as well.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: I thought he had to put his own name.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: He must put his own name on the prescription.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: That was my question.
He can just put Texas Optical but he is got to put the name of the person who did it.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That is correct, yes sir.
He has got to sign his own name, just as I sign my own name to the briefs in this court, but legitimately under the First Amendment --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Not Dr. Rogers didn't -- Dr. Rogers did not sign all of those prescriptions?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, no sir, the man who perform the examination --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Now when he made that advertisement, then the people get idea that he will.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, because he does not hold out to the public that he is present and he is performing the examination.
He merely list the name Texas State Optical.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: In fact, Mr. Keith, is it not true that he may not, not only does not, but may not disclose his ownership of 64 of the 65 offices he owns.
Isn't there a statutory prohibition against the use of his name in the offices in which he does not practice, even though he owns and dominates those offices.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, he may not hold himself out as practicing in that office and that may be different.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Well therefore is it not true that even though he is the Managing Director in a sense of all of those offices, nothing in those offices would so reveal.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That is correct.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Now do you challenge the statutory provision that requires that non-disclosure?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: You don't?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, because in the case of Dr. Carp, there was a suggestion that some type of misrepresentation arose.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Who was that, Wichita Falls?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, yes sir.
We do not challenge any effort by the state to restrict or circumscribe deceit or fraud or misrepresentation at all.
It is the absolute ban against truthful speech that we appeal to this court.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Do you think there is a higher value and Dr. Rogers being able to tell the public that TOA, the trade name whatever it is operates the office else where, than his ability to tell them that he operates, he does not assert to write it to disclose his own connection with these other offices.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, there is a higher right, because he is in association with others and they have developed as Justice Powell suggested a secondary meaning of goodwill and reputation attended to a high quality of service through many, many years.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: But couldn't he get the same secondary meaning attached to his own name if it was made clear that he is the dominant figure in all these offices.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: It might but he has been at this for 39 years and it would be very difficult to start over and acquire the same reputational interest and goodwill in any reasonable period of time and it is this interest which is not only --

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Because that is a property interest?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, it is a property interest, the reputation and goodwill.

The consequences of this ban, not to mention the purely theoretical First Amendment consequences, but the immediate and direct consequences of this ban are testified to by Dr. Benham in this court and in the Federal Trade Commission have both cited as authority.
One is that since there is less information and that is Dr. Benham's testimony, this results in higher cost and consequently less use.

As this court said in Virginia Pharmacy and as Dr. Benham testified, the moment the price goes up, the consequences fall heaviest on those who need glasses the most; that is the ill, the aged, and the economically depressed.
As a result, fewer people are able to obtain the services or goods that they need.
As a consequence then in the aggregate throughout the country or throughout a large state of Texas, you have a lower degree or quality of care.
Society and the free enterprise system under the decisions of this court suffer substantially because our free enterprise system depends on an intelligent private economic decision.

Once you constrain information as this court and as Dr. Benham has testified, once you constrain this information, this results in what the court has called a misallocation of resources, which then weakens in turn our free enterprise system, which is based on full disclosure respectfully rather than less information.

turn.speaker: lewis_f_powell_jr
turn.label: Justice Lewis F. Powell, Jr.
turn.text: Mr. Keith, you mentioned the Federal Trade Commission Regulation, do you think that has any bearing on this case?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Respectfully I do not sir.
Neither party has suggested that it is mooted by the Federal Trade Commission order and I do not believe that it is.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Mr. Keith, you talk of constraining information.

The specific information that's constrained is as I understand your argument, that all these offices follow the same high standards or open the same hours, charge the same fees, provide the same prompt services and all the like, is that basically what you are saying?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: What if 64 of the offices do and sit and the 65th has a different opening and closing hours and has a very crabby receptionist, and has different things, wouldn't that 65th office get the benefit of the information as the other 64 which would not be true?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: And if those facts occurred and there is no evidence in this record --

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Certainly we cannot assume that in fact all 65 offices are precisely identical in all respects, can we?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: I think that is correct Your Honor, but the trade name does not guarantee human inviolability.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: But it does not really guarantee any specific item of information will be true in the 65th office, does it?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That is correct, but it does --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Then what information is constrained?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: It does represent that this bundle of services is available and if this constitutes a misrepresentation, then the state has another statute, it does not need to rely on the trade name ban, it has another statute to preclude and suppress that misrepresentation.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: I understand but you have not identified for me any specific item of information that is constrained by the enforcement of the statute.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: It is the entire bundle of information.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Which may or may not be true in particular cases.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Which factually Your Honor under this record is true except with respect may be to the enthusiasm which one or another professional may apply to his work in any given day.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: This record shows that all 65 are equally graded?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Rather Your Honor, the record is absolutely silent, the record says that these offices all operate in this manner and there is no suggestion to the contrary.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: But you can say that two doctors are equal.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir and the record does not suggest such.
I am saying if the offices are all operated -- I would think --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: How many optometrists.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: I would think substantially 100.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: But is there anyway in the world that those 100 could be the same?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: There are 100 different reasons with 100 different offices operating in 65 different places under 65 different circumstances.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: But at the same time Your Honor neither could every associate or every lawyer at Covington & Burling, be the same but the use of the name Cromball & Solomon (ph) or Covington & Burling does convey to the listener a reputation for integrity, ability, industry, service to the client.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Not in all 64 of these offices?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That's correct.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Do they have 64?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: And not in any one of the offices are both lawyers of the same industry ability and integrity but as a whole the trade name conveys valuable information with respect to that firm.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: It is quite sort of like McDonald's hamburger, you know generally what to expect wherever you find it, isn't that the idea, even though there is a variation among cooks and among stores?

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: There is a lot of difference between having Dyspepsia and going blind.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir but and that is true and the state has very carefully and very closely regulated the optometrist in his professional functions to make certain that he does provide a minimum standard of care.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: Mr. Keith, if Covington & Burling decided they wanted to practice under the name “Big Judgments”, would they have a constitutional right to do so?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Your Honor, could I state it differently, if my firm wanted to practice under the name “Big Judgments” --

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: I will say ‘Quality Practice' then. Say what you said, would they have a constitutional right?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir because I think that represents some type of puffing that and some type of deceit associated with puffing.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: They are defense counsel, so they practice under the name Small Ones.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That would be more appropriate, yes sir.
I think that likewise would tend to mislead.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: What about the name “Prompt Service” something like, so it is something that they could demonstrate was not deceitful at all with respect to their own operation, could they have a constitutional right to use a name, you know some non-personal name just the trade like TOA.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice John Paul Stevens
turn.text: You think they have a constitutional right.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir because that involves the essential element of communication of speech and so long as it is non-deceptive, then it is protected by the First Amendment guarantee.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: I couldn't protect myself in private practice from being called a Freebie Lawyer, but that is alright.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: May I turn Your Honor respectfully for a moment to the question of equal protection raised in the matter of board appointment.
The reason that Dr. Rogers is not eligible for membership in the TOA is because Dr. Rogers exercises and claims the right to exercise his first amendment rights.
That is why he is not eligible and that is exactly what the code of ethics of the Texas Optometric Association prescribed.
It precluded membership to anyone who advertises price, it precluded membership to anyone who used a trade name and it precluded membership to anyone who operated more than three offices.
He applied, he was not eligible and he was disqualified from the membership.
He was disqualified because of the expression of his fundamental First Amendment right, whether you call that the ‘right of speech or the right of association'.
The case becomes much like that of Turner v. Fouche, decided by this court in 1970.
There the Georgia statute required that to be appointed to a school board, a person had to be a free holder.
The court recognized that none of us and certainly Dr. Rogers recognizes that none of us have a right to be considered for public service.
However none of us have a constitutional right to be appointed, but we do have a right to be considered for public service without an invidious discriminatory disqualification.

And the state may not deny to some the privilege of holding office that extends to others on a basis that violates constitutional guarantee and that's exactly what the state has done in this instance.

They have said that because you exercise your First Amendment right, there are four of six seats on that board that you are not eligible to be appointed to and that is plainly and simply the argument made.
There is respectfully no rational or legitimate reason for this regulation as colloquy with Mr. Neman(ph) suggested.

If you presume bias against law enforcement by Dr. Rogers and certainly there is no evidence of such in this case, that would be just like presuming bias to the Solicitor General to say that he could not fairly sit and serve as a judge.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: What if the incoming Governor of Texas, whomever that may be, were to announce as part of his platform that he was going to make sure that four out of the six members of the Texas Optometry -- Texas Board or members of the TOA during his administration.
Could you challenge his appointments, if they conform to that promise?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: If that became a pattern or practice that became state policy, I think so.

If it were a single instance where the incoming Governor says, I am going to pay political debt to this organization and I am going to appoint four members of that organization to the board, I think not.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: What if say a Governor appointing judges says, I think we need more representation of certain groups, do you think someone who isn't appointed could challenge that?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: No sir, I do not until it became a policy that was discriminatory because of the exercise of a fundamental interest such as free speech.

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: Until it became the equivalent of State Law.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir or --

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: The equivalent.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: The equivalent of State Law, thank you.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: How about the state statutes that says that three members of the commission must be appointed from the opposite party?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: That is the Federal Power Commission Regulation under Federal Law and --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: No, I am talking about the Texas.
Texas pays a law and says that and I think this is done in most states, it is done in Federal Government, is it not?M

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir but --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: That on this commission, there have been so many members of the opposite party.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: And the purpose there is to achieve a legitimate balance.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: I assume so, they don't say what.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir and I do not know those cases frankly.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: Well, may you know it is a fact then?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, I do know what is the fact.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: And nobody is objected to design level

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: I am not aware of the basis of the decision in that respect.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: There are statutes that provide that and so far as I know they have never been challenged, how do you distinguish them from this statute that you are challenging?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Because in this instance, I am excluded from consideration because I have exercised this fundamental right.
I am placed in a separate distinct category.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Well, if they are sort of published in the agency and Federal Trade commission or a democratic vacancy on the Federal Trade Commission, presumably all people of the opposite party are excluded because they have exercised their First Amendment right of free association to belong to the party which vacancy doesn't belong to.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Yes sir, but in the course of -- we are not speaking about just one appointment, we are now speaking about the course or let us say three appointments or four appointments.
I would then have equal opportunity to belong or be appointed to that body.
In this instance, that is not true.
I do not have the same equal opportunity as the other optometrists who do not exercise First Amendment right of speech or association.

Now Mr. Justice Marshal asked the question about this perpetual minority on the board and the evidence in this case, it is not in the appendix but it is before the court in the form of board minutes, shows that since the composition of this board under this act, there have been some 60 instances where the board has voted four to two.
Now indeed Dr. Rogers can --

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: 60 out of how many?
60 does not tell us anything.
60 out of 600 or 60 out of 100?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: I cannot answer that question in fact.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Then it does not mean very much, does it?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Except that it represents, Your Honor, the fact that not only is your bias in the appointment but this has a substantial impact in the service upon the Board.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Not unless you tell us the rest of the story.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: May I ask --

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: 6 out of 600, is it in the record?

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: It is in the record yes sir but you would have to be --

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: From the record, you can tell us, but if it isn't, you cannot.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: By post-submission memorandum.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: If it is in the record, point out to where in the record that appears.

turn.speaker: robert_q_keith
turn.label: Mr. Robert Q. Keith
turn.text: Thank you, sir.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you gentlemen.
The case is submitted.
